get.description:
Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) Interface Configurations.
Upon configuration, this profile is to be referenced from either a
VLAN profile or a port profile.
VRRP specifies an election protocol to provide the virtual router function
described below.  All protocol messaging is performed using IP multicast
datagrams, thus the protocol can operate over a variety of multiaccess LAN
technologies supporting IP multicast. The virtual router MAC address is used
as the source in all periodic VRRP messages sent by the Active router to enable
bridge learning in an extended LAN.
A virtual router is defined by its virtual router identifier (VRID) and a set
of IP addresses.  A VRRP router may associate a virtual router with its real
addresses on an interface, and may also be configured with additional virtual
router mappings and priority for virtual routers it is willing to standby.
A Standby router will not attempt to preempt the Active unless it has higher
priority. This eliminates service disruption unless a more preferred path
becomes available. It is also possible to administratively prohibit all
preemption attempts. The only exception is that a VRRP router will always
become Active of any virtual router associated with addresses it owns. If the
Active becomes unavailable then the highest priority Standby will transition to
Active after a short delay, providing a controlled transition of the virtual
router responsibility with minimal service interruption.

AOS-CX : VRRP can be configured on physical ports, VLAN interfaces and LAG interfaces.
     All such configurations work in the mentioned interfaces context.
     VRRP mandates the associated interface to be routing interface.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaVrrpInterface_VrrpSchema.description:
Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) Interface Configurations.
Upon configuration, this profile is to be referenced from either a
VLAN profile or a port profile.
VRRP specifies an election protocol to provide the virtual router function
described below.  All protocol messaging is performed using IP multicast
datagrams, thus the protocol can operate over a variety of multiaccess LAN
technologies supporting IP multicast. The virtual router MAC address is used
as the source in all periodic VRRP messages sent by the Active router to enable
bridge learning in an extended LAN.
A virtual router is defined by its virtual router identifier (VRID) and a set
of IP addresses.  A VRRP router may associate a virtual router with its real
addresses on an interface, and may also be configured with additional virtual
router mappings and priority for virtual routers it is willing to standby.
A Standby router will not attempt to preempt the Active unless it has higher
priority. This eliminates service disruption unless a more preferred path
becomes available. It is also possible to administratively prohibit all
preemption attempts. The only exception is that a VRRP router will always
become Active of any virtual router associated with addresses it owns. If the
Active becomes unavailable then the highest priority Standby will transition to
Active after a short delay, providing a controlled transition of the virtual
router responsibility with minimal service interruption.

AOS-CX : VRRP can be configured on physical ports, VLAN interfaces and LAG interfaces.
     All such configurations work in the mentioned interfaces context.
     VRRP mandates the associated interface to be routing interface.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

tracking-items.description: List for VRRP Tracking Configurations to Alter the Virtual Router's Priority Value

x-enumDescriptions.VLAN: Tracking based on vlan state transition(s)
x-enumDescriptions.PORT: Tracking based on layer 2 interface state transition(s)
x-enumDescriptions.MASTER_UPTIME: Tracking based on how long we have been MASTER
x-enumDescriptions.MASTER_STATE: Tracking based on another vrrp's MASTER state

mode.description: Tracking type to alter the virtual router's priority value (Tracking mode 'uplink' available only for IPv4 address family)

interfaces.description: Gigabit ethernet interface to track the port's state

interval.description: Master elapsed time in minutes before tracking takes effect

vlans.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlans.description: VLAN identifier to use for tracking changes

identifier.description: Virtual router identifier to track MASTER state of another VRRP master

uplink-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
uplink-vlan.description: Uplink VLAN (This must be already created or must exist under Uplink list configuration)

x-enumDescriptions.ADD: To add value to the virtual router's priority (applicable for MASTER_UPTIME and MASTER_STATE tracking types)
x-enumDescriptions.SUBTRACT: To subtract value from the virtual router's priority when link goes down (applicable for VLAN, PORT and UPLINK tracking types)

priority-offset-op.x-typeDescription: Operation to alter the value of virtual router's priority
priority-offset-op.description: Priority offset operation, to add or to subtract virtual router's priority

ArubaVrrpInterface_VrrpInterfaceConfigur.description: Grouping for IPv4 and IPv6 VRRP Interface Configurations

router-id-address-family.description: Key combination of router-id and address-family separated by a tilde symbol, e.g., 1~IPV4

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

address.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address of the virtual router

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

items.description: List of secondary IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

preempt-delay.description: Router pre-emption delay (time to wait before becoming master)

version-3-checksum.description:
Enable VRRPv3 IPv4 checksum calculation.
VRRP version should be V3 when version-3-checksum is set

description.description: Description of the VRRP router instance

password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
password.description: Authentication password (applicable only for IPv4 address family)

ciphertext-password.description: Authentication password in cipher text (for IPv4 only)

hold-time.description: Hold-time interval (state machine vrrp starts listening to advertisements after holdtime expires; applicable only when preempt is disabled or preempt-delay is 0)

cluster-preempt.description: Cluster manager drives the VRRP state (applicable only for IPv4 address family)

version.description: VRRP version. VRRP version can not be set to VRRP_V2 for address family IPV6

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

failback.description: Attempt to failback to VR when it is not enabled.

failover.description: Attempt to failover to VR when it is not enabled.

with-monitoring.description: Continue monitor of main VR during failover.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
